definition: to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]

sentences.english: It did good for increasing seeds yield. The key period which affected seeds yield was from tillering to jointing.
sentences.chinese: 分蘖期至拔节期是影响种子产量最关键时期。

sentences.english: The suitable time of the chemical spraying should be among the standing to jointing stage.
sentences.chinese: 喷施时期宜在小麦起身期和拔节期。

sentences.english: Nitrogen topdressed at elongation for different wheat could result in the highest yield.
sentences.chinese: 拔节期是不同类型专用小麦最佳氮肥高产施用期。

sentences.english: For early rice, young panicle formation stage and elongation stage often overlapped.
sentences.chinese: 就早稻而言，稻穗分化期和拔节期几乎同时进行。

sentences.english: The survival rate of nymphs feeding on rice plant at elongation stage was the highest.
sentences.chinese: 若虫以取食拔节期稻株存活率最高。

definition: the embryonic development of grain while still on the stem
tiller (stem at the base of grass plants)
to sprout/to come out (of seedling)/to bud
(of plants) to turn green again/to revegetate
to plant early/to sow seeds in early spring/early sowing
the state of moisture in the soil (and whether it can support a crop)
